intro: Eriocaulon compressum var. harperi, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in dense spikes, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
